SUR608.name: Junior Surgery Clerkship
SUR608.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SUR608.description: Basic clinical and surgical skills applied to commonly presenting problems. Preoperative, operative and post-operative care of patients with elective, emergent and trauma related illness. Psychosocial issues relevant to surgical patients. Operating room procedures.
SUR608.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Human Medicine.

SUR609.name: Otolaryngology Clerkship
SUR609.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SUR609.description: Common otolaryngologic disorders, emergencies. Diagnosis and treatment. Primary physician's judgments about management.
SUR609.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Human Medicine.

SUR610.name: Plastic Surgery Clerkship
SUR610.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SUR610.description: Principles of wound healing and tissue repair. Indications and applications of plastic surgery procedures.
SUR610.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Human Medicine.

SUR611.name: Urology Clerkship
SUR611.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SUR611.description: Demonstration of clinical manifestations of genito-urinary disease, investigative methods and techniques of diagnosis and management. Urologic emergencies and performance of basic urologic skills.
SUR611.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Human Medicine.

SUR612.name: General Surgery Sub-Internship
SUR612.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SUR612.description: Exposure to wide range of surgical problems as an integral part of the surgical team.
SUR612.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Human Medicine.

SUR613.name: Orthopedic Surgery Clerkship
SUR613.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SUR613.description: Diagnosis and management skills in common orthopedic problems. Orthopedic emergencies.
SUR613.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Human Medicine.

SUR614.name: Neurosurgery Clerkship
SUR614.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SUR614.description: Problems related to common emergent and elective neurosurgery involving the brain, spine, and peripheral nerves. Neurological examinations, diagnostic methods.
SUR614.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Human Medicine.

SUR615.name: Ophthalmology Clerkship
SUR615.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SUR615.description: Medical and surgical treatment of eye diseases. Clinical experiences include private office practice, surgical observations, pre-and post-operative care.
SUR615.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Human Medicine.

SUR616.name: Cardiothoracic Surgery Clerkship
SUR616.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SUR616.description: Problem solving in cardio thoracic medicine and surgery. Diagnostic tools and tests, and indications for surgical procedures.
SUR616.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Human Medicine.

SUR617.name: Critical Care Clerkship
SUR617.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SUR617.description: Focused experience in critical care as part of a surgical team.
SUR617.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Human Medicine.

SUR618.name: Anesthesia Clerkship
SUR618.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SUR618.description: Common anesthetic agents and procedures. Operative and post-operative effects, complications, patient risk, cost. Performing anesthetic procedures under faculty supervision.
SUR618.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Human Medicine.

SUR619.name: Sub-specialty Surgery Clerkship
SUR619.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SUR619.description: Surgical domains not covered in other clerkship experiences in which students desire further exposure.
SUR619.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Human Medicine.

SUR620.name: Senior Surgery Clerkship
SUR620.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SUR620.description: Understanding of the principles of various surgical specialties, critically ill patients, or enhanced exposure to ambulatory general surgery.
SUR620.restrictions: Open only to graduate-professional students in the College of Human Medicine.

SUR622.name: Pediatric Orthopedic Surgery Clerkship
SUR622.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SUR622.description: Evaluation and management strategies for common pediatric orthopedic maladies.
SUR622.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Human Medicine.

SUR623.name: Sports Medicine Orthopedic Surgery Clerkship
SUR623.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SUR623.description: Evaluation and management strategies for common sports medicine maladies presenting to the orthopedic surgeon.
SUR623.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Human Medicine.

SUR624.name: Vascular Surgery Clerkship
SUR624.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of even years, Summer of every year
SUR624.description: Evaluation, management and knowledge of vascular surgical conditions.
SUR624.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Human Medicine.

SUR625.name: Hand Surgery Clerkship
SUR625.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SUR625.description: Evaluation, management and knowledge of hand surgery conditions.
SUR625.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Human Medicine.

SUR626.name: Pediatric Surgery Clerkship
SUR626.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SUR626.description: Evaluation, management and knowledge of general pediatric surgical conditions.
SUR626.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Human Medicine.

SUR627.name: Burns Clerkship
SUR627.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SUR627.description: Evaluation, management and knowledge of burns in trauma patients.
SUR627.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Human Medicine.

SUR628.name: Trauma Surgery Clerkship
SUR628.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SUR628.description: Evaluation, management and knowledge in trauma patients.
SUR628.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Human Medicine.

SUR629.name: Colorectal Surgery Clerkship
SUR629.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SUR629.description: Evaluation, management and knowledge of colorectal surgical conditions.
SUR629.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Human Medicine.

SUR630.name: Surgical Wound Care Clerkship
SUR630.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SUR630.description: Evaluation, management and knowledge of wound care in surgical patients.
SUR630.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Human Medicine.

SUR631.name: Surgical Oncology Clerkship
SUR631.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SUR631.description: Evaluation, management and knowledge of surgical oncology conditions.
SUR631.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Human Medicine.

SUR632.name: Surgical Nutrition Clerkship
SUR632.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SUR632.description: Evaluation, management and knowledge of nutrition in critically-ill surgical patients.
SUR632.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Human Medicine.

SUR633.name: Extended Clinical Experience
SUR633.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SUR633.description: Based in community hospitals and ambulatory sites, this is a 4 week clinical experience emphasizing interviewing skills, history, physical exam, problem solving and therapy.

SUR641.name: Surgery in the Late Clinical Experience I
SUR641.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SUR641.description: Diagnosis and management of common patient problems in the general surgical setting
SUR641.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Human Medicine.

SUR642.name: Surgery in the Late Clinical Experience II
SUR642.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SUR642.description: Diagnosis and management of common patient problems in surgical subspecialties
SUR642.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Human Medicine.

SUR643.name: Surgical Critical Care
SUR643.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SUR643.description: Hospital-based clinical experience in evaluating and managing acutely ill surgical patients.
SUR643.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Human Medicine.

SUR644.name: Surgery in the Late Clinical Experience Remediation
SUR644.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SUR644.description: Interviewing skills, history, physical exam, problem solving and therapy based in community hospitals and/or ambulatory sites.
SUR644.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Human Medicine.

SUR645.name: Surgical Critical Care Remediation
SUR645.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SUR645.description: Hospital-based clinical experience in evaluating and managing acutely ill surgical patients.
SUR645.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Human Medicine.

SUR899.name: Master's Thesis Research
SUR899.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SUR899.restrictions: Open only to master's students in the Surgery major. Approval of department.
